locutie.beschrijving: The sermon focuses on the physical and historical reality of the Resurrection as an act of God, contrasting it with modern 'timid' metaphorical interpretations.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher focuses on the syntax of the Greek text (divine passive) and the historical context of the disciples' hopelessness.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the truth of the Resurrection and critiques false views, moving toward a celebratory declaration at the end.
voorbeelden: I know it isn't possible as we understand possibility.
The New Testament says something quite different.
He is not here; he is risen.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from skepticism or 'vague hope' to awe-struck belief in God's objective victory over death.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher asks God to 'confirm this miracle in our lives' at the conclusion.

voorbeelden: The New Testament refers to death as an enemy.
The women were not going to Jesus' grave with any sort of expectation.
Matthew means for it to strike us with awe.
Do you believe what you have said?
Think about this.
Go quickly and tell his disciples.
I confess that it is not enough for me.
I can feel the goosebumps on the back of my neck.
What a wonderful custom.
He goes before us.
We will see him.
He is risen indeed!
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from scripture rather than directly formulated as 'I promise you on behalf of God,' but they function as communal certainties.

voorbeelden: The Lord is risen!
The victory of life is won.
The powers of death have done their worst; but Christ their legions hath dispersed.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strong. The preacher uses the liturgical 'Christ is risen' and the 'Hallelujah' of Revelation to create a reality-shifting atmosphere.

indicatoren: Extensive quoting of other sermons to critique them.
Long historical descriptions of the disciples' psychological state.
Intellectual defense against skepticism ('I know all the objections').
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually convinced of the Resurrection's 'otherness,' but remains a spectator for much of the discourse.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the hearer's specific death/sin in the present tense
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' is delayed until the final liturgical crescendo.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality, but framed as a future hope or a general fact.
voorbeelden: He goes before us; we will see him.
May God confirm this miracle in our lives.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for personal testimony ('I confess') and to build rapport.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct questions ('Do you believe?') and final blessing.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode. Talking about 'the disciples,' 'the women,' 'the world,' and 'the New Testament.'
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical-critical distance that the preacher must work to bridge.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Narrating the Easter events and the history of the early church.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about death and God's power.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the snowy New England day and the liturgical greeting.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly avoids the 'Assertive -> Directive' (Moralism) trap by critiquing sermons that make the Resurrection about 'our strength to emulate Jesus.'
voorbeelden: The Resurrection is the divine inspiration for us... [Critiqued as insufficient]

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (The tomb is empty) to the Declarative (Christ has triumphed) to the Commissive (He goes before you).
voorbeelden: He is risen; he goes before us; we will see him.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is effective because it is grounded in the 'extra nos' (outside of us) action of God.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Spring will come... because God has raised his Son.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a high volume of constative language used to clear intellectual ground, the sermon culminates in a performative 'event' where the victory of Christ is proclaimed as a present reality.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus has beaten down death, routed the hosts of Satan.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a sense of cosmic victory that transcends the hearer's feelings.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I have heard and read many Easter sermons... Here are some actual quotes...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Spends significant time 'talking about' other people's bad preaching, which is a meta-discourse that delays the encounter.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final third when the preacher stops arguing with skeptics and starts 'singing' the victory of God.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of the 'Easter Greeting' and the Revelation hymns functions as a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, emphasized through the angel's words as God's own announcement.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strongly implied in the final blessing.
tekstueel_bewijs: The syntax clearly indicates that their recognition... was initiated by God.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low visibility, though the 'opening of eyes' implies the Spirit's work.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher asks God to 'confirm this miracle.'
tekstueel_bewijs: May God confirm this miracle in our lives.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the word is treated as 'dynamite' that changes the situation.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (Assertives). It needs more 'I announce' or 'He promises you' (Commissives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The New Testament refers to death as an enemy.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, I declare to you that your enemy, Death, has been defeated.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a report about a book to a declaration of a new reality for the hearer.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often framed as a quote from the angel rather than the preacher's own delivery of the goods.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more 2nd person direct address in the middle of the sermon.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He is risen, your fear no longer has the final word.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on 'the disciples' (3rd person).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Bridge the gap between the 1st century and the 'snowy New England day' earlier.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, like the women, may have come here expecting nothing but a grave.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually very good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestion: Maintain the focus on God's indicative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of high-illocutionary preaching that successfully avoids moralism, though it struggles slightly with the 'constative surplus' of academic critique.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (the goosebumps), but SAT shows the sermon's power is in the 'Declarative' act of God's victory, regardless of the preacher's feelings.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'battle imagery' for its persuasiveness; SAT praises it for its 'illocutionary force'â€”it doesn't just describe a battle, it announces a victory.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher's critique of other sermons is a 'locutionary detour' that momentarily halts the performative flow of the Gospel.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He is not here; he is risen.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The hinge of the entire sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a masterclass in establishing the 'Extra Nos' of the Gospel before moving to the 'Pro Me'.
